channel.title: Tatsumoto Ren
channel.description: How to use Free Software to learn Japanese, and more.

item.title: Plumbing for language learners
item.description:
In this article let's talk about passing text between applications Usually people simply select and copy-paste text from one window to the other, but there's a way to make it faster by using the concept of plumbing.

Plumbing is something that can make using a computer so much more convenient and fast. I think everybody should use it.
item.dc:creator: Tatsumoto

item.title: Mass immersion
item.description:
AJATT targets people who want to reach a high level in the language and truly become fluent. One of the most important parts of AJATT is immersing yourself in Japanese as close to 24 hours a day as possible, combining that with spaced repetition and other technology.

Immersion is quite important, we already know that. Let's figure out how much immersion is necessary.
item.dc:creator: Tatsumoto

item.title: Japanese locale
item.description: A Locale is a set of information that most programs use for determining country and language specific settings. Since you're learning Japanese, generate and enable the Japanese locale on your system.
item.dc:creator: Tatsumoto

item.title: Condensing active immersion
item.description: Watching movies and TV shows counts towards active immersion and requires full attention to the content. We can apply a little optimization to condense active immersion. This small trick helps if you're watching something boring or if you're tight on time.
item.dc:creator: Tatsumoto

item.title: Kana Anki decks
item.description: These Anki deck teach hiragana and katakana. There's a Recognition deck and a Production deck. The Recognition deck teaches how to read kana, the Production deck teaches how to write kana from memory.
item.dc:creator: Tatsumoto

item.title: Matrix quickstart guide
item.description: This article is a user guide to Matrix. It also covers the most popular Matrix client program, Element.

item.title: How Anki works
item.description: Since in this guide we are going to use Anki to study our target language, let's talk about how it works.

item.title: Spaced repetition
item.description: To study efficiently and help you keep track of the learning process one of the first things you're going to want to do is obtain a spaced repetition system. In this article let's cover the theory behind spaced repetition, why you need it and what system to use.
item.dc:creator: Tatsumoto

item.title: JLPT Tango N1 Anki deck
item.description:
3000 Essential Vocabulary for the JLPT N1, also known as JLPT Tango N1, is a textbook to prepare for the JLPT N1. It contains ~2000 Japanese sentences and their English translations. The book includes vocabulary found commonly on the JLPT and often used in everyday life.

With the help of our chat members, we have created an Anki deck from sentences listed in the book and native audio that comes with it.
item.dc:creator: Tatsumoto

item.title: Learning grammar
item.description: What's grammar? Should you learn grammar? How to learn grammar? Let's answer these question in this article.
